Threats to "Vehicle communication channe: Spoofing of messages (e.g. 802.11p V2X during platooning, GNSS messages, etc.) by impersonation
Mitigation: The vehicle shall verify the authenticity and integrity of messages it receives

Threats to "Vehicle communication channe: Sybil attack (in order to spoof other vehicles as if there are many vehicles on the road)
Mitigation: Security controls shall be implemented for storing cryptographic keys (e.g., use of Hardware Security Modules)

Threats to "Vehicle communication channe: Communication channels permit code injection into vehicle held data/code, for example tampered software binary might be injected into the communication stream
Mitigation:
The vehicle shall verify the authenticity and integrity of messages it receives
Systems shall implement security by design to minimize risks

Threats to "Vehicle communication channe: Communication channels permit manipulation of vehicle held data/code
Mitigation: Access control techniques and designs shall be applied to protect system data/code

Threats to "Vehicle communication channe: Communication channels permit overwrite of vehicle held data/code
Communication channels permit erasure of vehicle held data/code
Communication channels permit introduction of data/code to vehicle systems (write data code)
Accepting information from an unreliable or untrusted source
Mitigation: The vehicle shall verify the authenticity and integrity of messages it receives

Threats to "Vehicle communication channe: Man in the middle attack / session hijacking
Mitigation: The vehicle shall verify the authenticity and integrity of messages it receives

Threats to "Vehicle communication channe: Replay attack, for example an attack against a communication gateway allows the attacker to downgrade software of an ECU or firmware of the gateway
Interception of information / interfering radiations / monitoring communications
Mitigation: Confidential data transmitted to or from the vehicle shall be protected

Threats to "Vehicle communication channe: Gaining unauthorized access to files or data
Mitigation: Through system design and access control it should not be possible for unauthorized personnel to access personal or system critical data. Example of Security Controls can be found in OWASP

Threats to "Vehicle communication channe: Sending a large number of garbage data to vehicle information system, so that it is unable to provide services in the normal manner
Mitigation: Measures to detect and recover from a denial of service attack shall be employed

Threats to "Vehicle communication channe: Black hole attack, disruption of communication between vehicles by blocking the transfer of messages to other vehicles
Mitigation: Measures to detect and recover from a denial of service attack shall be employed

Threats to "Vehicle communication channe: An unprivileged user is able to gain privileged access, for example root access
Mitigation: Measures to prevent and detect unauthorized access shall be employed

Threats to "Vehicle communication channe: Virus embedded in communication media infects vehicle systems
Mitigation: Measures to protect systems against embedded viruses/malware should be considered

Threats to "Vehicle communication channe: Malicious internal (e.g. CAN) messages
Mitigation: Measures to detect malicious internal messages or activity should be considered

Threats to "Vehicle communication channe: Malicious V2X messages, e.g. infrastructure to vehicle or vehicle-vehicle messages (e.g. CAM, DENM)
Mitigation: The vehicle shall verify the authenticity and integrity of messages it receives

Threats to "Vehicle communication channe: Malicious diagnostic messages
Malicious proprietary messages (e.g. those normally sent from OEM or component/system/function supplier)
Compromise of over the air software update procedures. This includes fabricating the system update program or firmware
Mitigation: Secure software update procedures shall be employed

Threats to "Vehicle communication channe: Compromise of local/physical software update procedures. This includes fabricating the system update program or firmware
The software is manipulated before the update process (and is therefore corrupted), although the update process is intact
Compromise of cryptographic keys of the software provider to allow invalid update
Mitigation: Security controls shall be implemented for storing cryptographic keys

Threats to "Vehicle communication channe: Denial of Service attack against update server or network to prevent rollout of critical software updates and/or unlock of customer specific features
Mitigation: Security Controls shall be applied to back-end systems. Where back-end servers are critical to the provision of services there are recovery measures in case of system outage. Example Security Controls can be found in OWASP

Threats to "Vehicle communication channe: Innocent victim (e.g. owner, operator or maintenance engineer) is tricked into taking an action to unintentionally load malware or enable an attack
Mitigation: Measures shall be implemented for defining and controlling user roles and access privileges, based on the principle of least access privilege

Threats to "Vehicle communication channe: Defined security procedures are not followed
Mitigation: Organizations shall ensure security procedures are defined and followed including logging of actions and access related to the management of the security functions

Threats to "Vehicle communication channe: Manipulation of functions designed to remotely operate vehicle systems, such as remote key, immobiliser, and charging pile
Mitigation: Security controls shall be applied to systems that have remote access

Threats to "Vehicle communication channe: Manipulation of vehicle telematics (e.g. manipulate temperature measurement of sensitive goods, remotely unlock cargo doors)
Interference with short range wireless systems or sensors
Corrupted applications, or those with poor software security, used as a method to attack vehicle systems
Mitigation:
Software shall be security assessed, authenticated and integrity protected. 
Security controls shall be applied to minimise the risk from third party software that is intended or foreseeable to be hosted on the vehicle

Threats to "Vehicle communication channe: External interfaces such as USB or other ports used as a point of attack, for example through code injection
Mitigation: Security controls shall be applied to external interfaces

Threats to "Vehicle communication channe: Media infected with viruses connected to the vehicle
Diagnostic access (e.g. dongles in OBD port) used to facilitate an attack, e.g. manipulate vehicle parameters (directly or indirectly)
Mitigation: Security controls shall be applied to external interfaces

Threats to "Vehicle communication channe: Extraction of copyright or proprietary software from vehicle systems (product piracy / stolen software)
Mitigation: Access control techniques and designs shall be applied to protect system data/code. Example Security Controls can be found in OWASP

Threats to "Vehicle communication channe: Unauthorized access to the owner’s privacy information such as personal identity, payment account information, address book information, location information, vehicle’s electronic ID, etc.
Mitigation: Through system design and access control it should not be possible for unauthorized personnel to access personal or system critical data. Examples of Security Controls can be found in OWASP

Threats to "Vehicle communication channe: Extraction of cryptographic keys
Mitigation: Security controls shall be implemented for storing cryptographic keys e.g. Security Modules

Threats to "Vehicle communication channe: Illegal/unauthorised changes to vehicle’s electronic ID
Mitigation: Access control techniques and designs shall be applied to protect system data/code. Example Security Controls can be found in OWASP

Threats to "Vehicle communication channe: Identity fraud. For example, if a user wants to display another identity when communicating with toll systems, manufacturer backend
Action to circumvent monitoring systems (e.g. hacking/ tampering/ blocking of messages such as ODR Tracker data, or number of runs)
Mitigation:
Access control techniques and designs shall be applied to protect system data/code. Example Security Controls can be found in OWASP.
Data manipulation attacks on sensors or transmitted data could be mitigated by correlating the data from different sources of information

Threats to "Vehicle communication channe: Data manipulation to falsify vehicle’s driving data (e.g. mileage, driving speed, driving directions, etc.)
Unauthorised changes to system diagnostic data
Unauthorized deletion/manipulation of system event logs
Mitigation: Access control techniques and designs shall be applied to protect system data/code. Example Security Controls can be found in OWASP.

Threats to "Vehicle communication channe: Introduce malicious software or malicious software activity
Mitigation: Access control techniques and designs shall be applied to protect system data/code. Example Security Controls can be found in OWASP.

Threats to "Vehicle communication channe: Fabrication of software of the vehicle control system or information system
Denial of service, for example this may be triggered on the internal network by flooding a CAN bus, or by provoking faults on an ECU via a high rate of messaging
Mitigation: Measures to detect and recover from a denial of service attack shall be employed

Threats to "Vehicle communication channe: Unauthorized access to falsify configuration parameters of vehicle’s key functions, such as brake data, airbag deployed threshold, etc.
Mitigation: Access control techniques and designs shall be applied to protect system data/code. Example Security Controls can be found in OWASP

Threats to "Vehicle communication channe: Unauthorized access to falsify charging parameters, such as charging voltage, charging power, battery temperature, etc.
Combination of short encryption keys and long period of validity enables attacker to break encryption
Mitigation: Cybersecurity best practices for software and hardware development shall be followed

Threats to "Vehicle communication channe: Insufficient use of cryptographic algorithms to protect sensitive systems
Using deprecated cryptographic algorithms
Hardware or software, engineered to enable an attack or fail to meet design criteria to stop an attack
Mitigation: Cybersecurity best practices for software and hardware development shall be followed

Threats to "Vehicle communication channe: The presence of software bugs can be a basis for potential exploitable vulnerabilities. This is particularly true if software has not been tested to verify that known bad code/bugs is not present and reduce the risk of unknown bad code/bugs being present
Mitigation:
Cybersecurity best practices for software and hardware development shall be followed. 
Cybersecurity testing with adequate coverage

Threats to "Vehicle communication channe: Using remainders from development (e.g. debug ports, JTAG ports, microprocessors, development certificates, developer passwords, …) can permit an attacker to access ECUs or gain higher privileges
Superfluous internet ports left open, providing access to network systems

Circumvent network separation to gain control. Specific example is the use of unprotected gateways, or access points (such as truck-trailer gateways), to circumvent protections and gain access to other network segments to perform malicious acts, such as sending arbitrary CAN bus messages
Mitigation:
Cybersecurity best practices for software and hardware development shall be followed. 
Cybersecurity best practices for system design and system integration shall be followed

Threats to "Vehicle communication channe: Information breach. Personal data may be breached when the car changes user (e.g. is sold or is used as hire vehicle with new hirers)
Mitigation: Best practices for the protection of data integrity and confidentiality shall be followed for storing personal data.

Threats to "Vehicle communication channe: Manipulation of OEM hardware, e.g. unauthorised hardware added to a vehicle to enable "man-in-the-middle" attack
Mitigation: Measures to prevent and detect unauthorized access shall be employed

Threats to "Vehicle communication channe: Abuse of privileges by staff (insider attack)
Mitigation: Security Controls are applied to back-end systems to minimise the risk of insider attack

Threats to "Vehicle communication channe: Unauthorised internet access to the server (enabled for example by backdoors, unpatched system software vulnerabilities, SQL attacks or other means)
Mitigation: Security Controls are applied to back-end systems to minimise unauthorised access. Example Security Controls can be found in OWASP

Threats to "Vehicle communication channe: Unauthorised physical access to the server (conducted by for example USB sticks or other media connecting to the server)
Mitigation: Through system design and access control it should not be possible for unauthorised personnel to access personal or system critical data

Threats to "Vehicle communication channe: Attack on back-end server stops it functioning, for example it prevents it from interacting with vehicles and providing services they rely on
Mitigation: Security Controls are applied to back-end systems. Where back-end servers are critical to the provision of services there are recovery measures in case of system outage. Example Security Controls can be found in OWASP

Threats to "Vehicle communication channe: Loss of information in the cloud. Sensitive data may be lost due to attacks or accidents when data is stored by third-party cloud service providers
Mitigation: Security Controls are applied to minimise risks associated with cloud computing. Example Security Controls can be found in OWASP and NCSC cloud computing guidance

Threats to "Vehicle communication channe: Information breach by unintended sharing of data (e.g. admin errors, storing data in servers in garages)
Mitigation: Security Controls are applied to back-end systems to prevent data breaches. Example Security Controls can be found in OWASP

Threats to "Vehicle communication channe: Innocent victim (e.g. owner, operator or maintenance engineer) is tricked into taking an action to unintentionally load malware or enable an attack
Mitigation: Measures shall be implemented for defining and controlling user roles and access privileges, based on the principle of least access privilege

Threats to "Vehicle communication channe: Defined security procedures are not followed
Mitigation: Organizations shall ensure security procedures are defined and followed including logging of actions and access related to the management of the security functions

Threats to "Vehicle communication channe: Damage caused by a third party. Sensitive data may be lost or compromised due to physical damages in cases of traffic accident or theft
Mitigation: Best practices for the protection of data integrity and confidentiality shall be followed for storing personal data. Example Security Controls can be found in ISO/SC27/WG5

Threats to "Vehicle communication channe: Loss from DRM (digital right management) conflicts. User data may be deleted due to DRM issues
The (integrity of) sensitive data may be lost due to IT components wear and tear, causing potential cascading issues (in case of key alteration, for example)
